TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ScrollContentPresenter extends System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter implements class System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IScrollInfo
Public NotInheritable Class ScrollContentPresenter Inherits ContentPresenter Implements IScrollInfo
type ScrollContentPresenter = class inherit ContentPresenter interface IScrollInfo

Docs.summary: Displays the content of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter> class provides support for styling the various components of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> control. For information about the scrolling region inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer>, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IScrollInfo>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter> to style the content of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> control.
[!code-xaml[custom_scrollviewer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/Custom_ScrollViewer/CS/default.xaml#1)]

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the content, if it supports , should be allowed to control scrolling.
Docs.value: if the content is allowed to scroll; otherwise, . A value indicates that the acts as the scrolling client. This property has no default value.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The bounding rectangle that identifies the coordinate space to make visible.
Docs.summary: Forces content to scroll until the coordinate space of a object is visible.
Docs.returns: A that represents the visible region.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In most cases, the returned <xref:System.Windows.Rect> is a transformed version of the input rectangle. In some cases, such as when the input rectangle cannot fit entirely within the viewport, the return value may be smaller.
